==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=督邮}}

===Etymology===
Established during the [[w:Han Dynasty|Western Han Dynasty]], a person in this position was the superintendent for all county-level officials who had a stipend in excess of 600 dàn ([[石]]) of rice (roughly 775 [[bushel]]s by today's standards). He was also in charge of inspecting the ancient equivalent of post offices ([[郵驛]]) for the county. However, these post offices would have only delivered official government documents. Each [[w:Commandery|Commandery]] was divided into a number of smaller counties; each of these counties was assigned a postal inspector. This position was abolished in the [[w:Tang Dynasty|Tang Dynasty]].
